poem:
**High Flyer to Pariah**

A banker's ascent,  
to stars entwined  
with shadows, whispering  
names and numbers.  
Epstein's echo,  
a faint, chilling breeze  
through ivory towers.  
Once gold, now tarnished—  
the hand that clasped  
the world's pulse,  
grips a fragile string.  
Fallen, unnamed,  
the silent unraveling.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "High flyer to pariah: the saga of Epstein-linked banker Jes Staley In 1999, the future Barclays chief executive Jes Staley was gearing up for his biggest job yet. As head of JP Morgan’s private bank, he would be in charge of a sprawling team that managed money and investments for some of the world’s richest people. Among them was the mysterious but well-connected billionaire Jeffrey Epstein, with whom he would quickly develop a “fairly close". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
